content:
(Verse 1)
Yo, listen up, I got a tale to tell,
'Bout a Mardi Gras crew, man, they raised some hell,
In Dothan city, where the party's alive,
Wet Bandits rollin' in, led by Tanner the wise.

They spotted a float with mermaids and dolphins,
Tanner said, "Let's take it, no ifs or ands, we're all in!"
They transformed it quick, made it nautical and naughty,
Renamed that bad boy, now it's called "Feeling Nauti."

(Chorus)
Feeling Nauti, floatin' through the night,
Wet Bandits raisin' chaos, but it feels so right,
In the city of Dothan, where Mardi Gras thrives,
Tanner Shelley and his crew, bringin' it alive.

(Verse 2)
They threw beads and trinkets, crowd goin' wild,
Water balloons flyin', like a crazy child,
People laughin', cheerin', lovin' the show,
Wet Bandits rockin' Mardi Gras, you already know.

But the cops, they came, tryna shut it down,
Tanner's too slick, he ain't wearin' no frown,
Into an alley, escaped without a trace,
Wet Bandits vanished, couldn't keep up the chase.

(Bridge)
A legend was born on that Mardi Gras night,
Feeling Nauti float, out of sight,
Tanner Shelley and his crew, they came and went,
But the memory stays, it's heaven-sent.

(Chorus)
Feeling Nauti, floatin' through the night,
Wet Bandits raisin' chaos, but it feels so right,
In the city of Dothan, where Mardi Gras thrives,
Tanner Shelley and his crew, bringin' it alive.

(Outro)
The night wore on, whispers filled the air,
'Bout the Wet Bandits' deeds, people couldn't help but stare,
They'll never forget the day the chaos came to town,
Feeling Nauti, Wet Bandits, they'll always wear the crown.
